SENT.plain: We report two cases of chronic infantile neurological, cutaneous, and articular (CINCA) syndrome
It is a rare congenital multisystemic inflammatory disease characterised by early onset of urticarial skin rash, central nervous system involvement and articular signs
Our two cases were first diagnosed at 13 and 14 years of age, respectively
From birth they presented with typical symptoms of CINCA syndrome, however isolated each symptom was non-specific
After the syndrome was recognised and treatment with anakinra was initiated, most symptoms disappeared
